Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Remote
Description:
En BETWEEN apostamos por ofrecerte las mejores oportunidades dentro del área tecnológica. Contamos con un equipo de más de 900 profesionales. Ser parte de nuestro equipo significa formar parte de una comunidad multicultural, con acceso a oportunidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional, generando impacto.

Si quieres desarrollar tus capacidades en un entorno internacional, apostando por trabajar en soluciones de I+D tanto en Ingeniería como en IT, ¡este es tu próximo destino!

Damos soporte en una gran variedad de áreas como Operaciones, Desarrollo de producto, Compras, Firmware, Software, Business Intelligence, Gestión, Transformación digital, ¡y muchas más! Además, desarrollamos soluciones tecnológicas a medida desde nuestros Hubs Tecnológicos.

¿Qué haré? Estas serán tus funciones principales:


Te integrarás como Machine Learning Engineer en un equipo multidisciplinar, trabajando en un entorno de alto nivel técnico e internacional.
Desarrollarás e implementarás modelos de machine learning y computer vision para transformar datos crudos en insights accionables y automatizaciones inteligentes.
Colaborarás en la implementación de ML Ops, asegurando el ciclo de vida completo de los modelos, desde el desarrollo hasta el despliegue en producción, con un enfoque en la automatización y la escalabilidad.
Trabajarás con frameworks de aprendizaje profundo como TensorFlow y PyTorch, así como con herramientas específicas para ML Ops y despliegue en la nube (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, GCP, Azure).
Participarás en todas las etapas del ciclo de vida del desarrollo de modelos de ML, incluyendo la investigación, diseño, entrenamiento, evaluación, y despliegue, asegurando la integridad y escalabilidad de los modelos en entornos de producción.
Asegurarás la conformidad de las soluciones de ML con las políticas de datos (incluyendo privacidad), así como con las directrices y estándares de arquitectura, seguridad, y calidad.
Colaborarás con stakeholders de negocio de diversos orígenes para implementar soluciones de ML que impacten los objetivos de la organización comercial.
Contribuirás a los objetivos de excelencia operativa, enfocándote en la fiabilidad, calidad, y escalabilidad de los modelos de ML, optimizando los procesos mediante la automatización y el despliegue continuo en entornos de cloud.
Participarás en actividades de evolución arquitectónica mediante la innovación y la adopción de nuevas tecnologías de ML, con un enfoque especial en computer vision y su aplicación en diversos casos de uso industriales y comerciales.



¿Cómo lo haré?


Tendrás horario flexible.
Podrás trabajar en modelo 100% remoto desde cualquier punto de España. Tendrás la opción de trabajar en oficina siempre que quieras, tanto en Sant Cugat con el equipo, o en la oficina de Between en BCN.
Tendrás un PC y los periféricos necesarios para el desarrollo de tu trabajo.



Si eres BETWEENER obtendrás estos beneficios:


Seguro médico con Sanitas.
Dispondrás de oportunidades de formación y desarrollo profesional: Idiomas, cursos en Udemy, Certificaciones, Programa The Power Business School y Bootcamps especializados (Agile, DevOps, IA & Big Data, Ciberseguridad, etc.).
Contarás con un equipo de Talento que te acompañará durante toda tu experiencia con nosotros. ¡Haremos un café una vez al mes! Así, mantendremos el contacto.
Pondremos a tu disposición un amplio abanico de retos y proyectos acordes con tus objetivos personales y profesionales.
Posibilidad de elegir cómo obtener parte de tu salario gracias a las ventajas fiscales de nuestra Retribución Flexible (Ticket restaurant, Ticket transporte, Ticket guardería).
Descuentos para acceder a centros de Fitness con Gympass.
Acceso a nuestro Club de Descuentos: Inspiring Benefits.
En BETWEEN nos gusta mucho hacer networking, por lo que te invitaremos a participar en todos estos eventos ¡y más!: las BETWEEN Nights, torneos deportivos, Black Mamba Race, viernes de vermut, juegos de mesa, etc.
Podrás disfrutar de nuestras fantásticas oficinas del 22@ las cuales disponen de Rooftop, tirador de cerveza, mesa de ping-pong y futbolín.
Programa de recomendación remunerado de Talento.
En BETWEEN, la igualdad de oportunidades es uno de nuestros valores. Nuestro compromiso es contratar al mejor talento independientemente de su raza, religión, sexo, edad y personas con otras capacidades y promover su desarrollo profesional y personal.



Requisitos:

Mínimos:


Ingeniería o Máster en Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística o equivalente.
+4 años de experiencia como ML Engineer o en roles similares.
Experiencia con frameworks de machine learning y deep learning como TensorFlow o PyTorch.
Experiencia con Python y bibliotecas de machine learning (e.g., scikit-learn, OpenCV).
Experiencia en el diseño, entrenamiento, y despliegue de modelos de ML en entornos Cloud (mínimo 1 año de experiencia con AWS, GCP o Azure).
Experiencia en ML Ops, incluyendo la automatización del ciclo de vida de los modelos y su monitoreo en producción.
Experiencia en Computer Vision, con proyectos aplicados en entornos industriales o comerciales.
Familiaridad con metodología Agile.
NIvel avanzado de inglés.
Actitud proactiva, resolutiva, y orientada a la ejecución.



Valorables:


Posgrado en Data Science o certificaciones en tecnologías clave (e.g., AWS Certified Machine Learning, TensorFlow Developer Certificate).
Experiencia con herramientas de orquestación y contenedores (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Conocimientos en prácticas de DevOps y su aplicación en proyectos de ML.
Experiencia en la optimización de modelos para su escalabilidad y rendimiento en entornos de producción.
Show more

Title: MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER
Description:
NDT Global is the leading provider of ultra-high-tech diagnostic inspection solutions, advanced data analysis and integrity assessment services for ensuring the safety and longevity of energy-sector infrastructure assets. Recognized as the forerunner in ultrasonic inspection technologies comprising Pulse Echo, Pitch-and-Catch and Phased Array, as well as Acoustic Resonance (ART Scan) methodologies, the company also deploys a range of non-ultrasonic technologies, such as Inertial Measurement Units, with more under development. NDT Global strategically applies its inspection technologies to detect, diagnose and model various types of threat—circumferential or axial cracks, metal loss, geometry, mapping, and more—across diverse classes of assets. By providing predictive, decision-ready insights driven by the world’s most accurate data, NDT Global enables the conditions for asset owners to optimize infrastructure health and drive operational efficiencies while reducing risk and minimizing their carbon footprint.




Purpose

The goal of the Machine Learning Engineer is to introduce new solutions based on machine learning, especially deep learning, to improve accuracy and efficiency of data analysis from data preparation, model training and testing to deployment in a productive environment.




Tasks

Applies supervised techniques, mostly deep learning techniques, for solving pattern recognition problems in ultrasound data (images, signals)
Understands and interprets data to come up with optimal feature sets
Prepares datasets to train and validate models
Ensures quality of the developed prototypes by software testing and code reviews
Writes documentation of developed solutions and ensures knowledge transfer




Requirements

University degree in Machine Learning, Computer Vision or similar
1 year of relevant work experience in deep learning, machine learning
Knowledge and experience in Pytorch, Tensorflow, Keras, or Jax is mandatory
Python knowledge is mandatory
Professional software development experience is preferred
Spark knowledge is preferred
Experience with git, git workflows, or contribution on git hub is preferred
Knowledge about standard python data science stack in preferred
Must be proficient in spoken and written English




Benefits

Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package: Health Insurance, pension Plan, Gym Flex, eyecare
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and make a significant impact on our data strategy
Opportunities for professional growth and development
Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Desde SII Group Spain buscamos un/a Data Scientist para formar parte de nuestro equipo💥




¿Tienes ganas de aprender y crecer profesionalmente?¿Cuentas con más de 4 años como Data Scientist y quieres embarcarte en nuevos proyectos 🚀?

¡Sin duda querrás conocer más sobre esta oportunidad! 😁




¿Qué te ofrecemos?🚀

Contrato indefinido 📝
Formación personalizada que te permitirá crecer📚: Podrás disponer de acceso a nuestras plataformas técnicas Pluralsight & OpenWebinars así como a Open Sessions que te permitirán mejorar tus soft skills con cursos de Mindfulness, coaching…
Teletrabajo: 4 días remoto🏡.
Paquete retributivo flexible: Te cuidamos y ponemos a tu disposición beneficios sociales (seguro médico privado, ticket restaurante, ticket guardería o ticket transporte).
Ambiente y equipos internacionales.
Somos una familia 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦: Sabemos que las personas son nuestro principal valor añadido y por eso queremos estar cerca de todos los compañeros realizando After-Works, cenas y eventos de empresa🥂
¡Somos un excelente lugar de trabajo! Certificados por Great Place to Work! 💥




¿Qué buscamos en ti? 💻🚀

Experiencia mínima de 4-5 años cómo científico de datos.
Conocimientos del lenguaje de programación Python y/o R.
Experiencia en el analisis de datos y modelado estadístico.
Alta capacidad de manipulación de datos y procesos ETL.
Nivel alto de inglés (B2).




¿Cómo es el equipo?

Profesional y amantes del trabajo en equipo.
Buen rollo y constante aprendizaje colaborativo.
Siempre ¡Todos a una!




¿Quiénes somos?

Somos una multinacional francesa que ofrece servicios y soluciones IT en todo el mundo, con presencia en 21 países y más de 16.000 profesionales.

Es por ello, que podrías disfrutar de movilidad geográfica si quieres vivir una experiencia internacional, así como participar en proyectos internacionales de gran envergadura.




Nuestro propósito es crear proyectos innovadores que faciliten la vida a nuestros clientes, contratando a los/las mejores profesionales y haciendo que se sientan realizados con su trabajo.




¡Eres el talento que buscamos!

Title: Data Scientists (hybrid from Barcelona, Spain)
Description:
ITMAGINATION helps its Clients by becoming a true extension of their software and data development capabilities. Through the readily set up, comprehensive, and self-governing teams, we let our Clients focus on their business while we make sure that their software products and data tools scale up accordingly and with outstanding quality.

We are looking for experienced team players to fill Data Scientists positions and participate in our up-and-coming projects for our client from the Banking industry.

You can expect:


Working with a highly skilled team of professionals
Data analysis, statistical modeling, and algorithm development


Requirements


Min. 5 years of experience in relevant position
Strong background in statistical analysis, machine learning, and data mining techniques
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Julia
Experience with data manipulation and visualization tools like SQL, Pandas, Matplotlib and Tableau
Ability to work with large-scale datasets and distributed computing frameworks such as Hadoop, Spark, or Dask
Experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch
Knowledge of cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform
Familiarity with big data technologies such as Kafka, Hive, or Cassandra
Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field
Excellent English skills


Benefits


Fully remote work model
Possibility of 20 business days off each year
Professional training programs – including Udemy and other development plans
Benefits package offer - Health Insurance, Sports Package, and Life Insurance offerings
Work with a team that’s recognized for its excellence. We’ve been featured in the Deloitte Technology Fast 50 & FT 1000 rankings. We’ve also received the Great Place To Work® certification for five years in a row


Please, attach your resume in English


Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
Working at Freudenberg: "We will wow your world!" This is our promise. As a global technology group, we not only make the world cleaner, healthier and more comfortable, but also offer our 52,000 employees a networked and diverse environment where everyone can thrive individually. Be surprised and experience your own wow moments.

Freudenberg Sealing Technologies is a longstanding technology expert and market leader for sophisticated and novel applications in sealing technology and electric mobility solutions worldwide. Thanks to our unique materials and technology expertise, we are a proven supplier for demanding products and applications, as well as a development and service partner to customers in the automotive industries and in general industries. With our approximately 13,500 employees worldwide, we generate sales of about 2.5 billion euros.

Some of your Benefits

Flexible Work Models: We allow for flexible work models to ensure both professional and personal success.

International Opportunities: Grow in your career through international exchange and global job opportunities.

Personal Development: We offer a variety of trainings to ensure you can develop in your career.

Safe Environment: We strive to ensure safety remains a top priority, and provide a stable environment for our employees.

Sustainability & Social Commitment: We support social and sustainable projects and encourage employee involvement.

Parets del Vallès

Hybrid Work

Freudenberg Sealing Technologies S.L.U.

Are you ready to make a significant impact as part of our expanding "Advanced Analytics" team? We are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer to drive the development and maintenance of our cutting-edge machine learning solutions.

Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/d)

Responsibilities


Innovative Solutions in Production: You are part of the growing team “Advanced Analytics” of machine learning experts and responsible for bringing and keeping our machine learning solutions in production
Codebase Enhancement: You take care of extending and distributing our machine learning codebase including automated code testing and documentation
Pipeline Design and Monitoring: You design and implement pipelines for the deployment and monitoring of our machine learning solutions
Continuous Improvement: You are intrinsically motivated to continuously improve implementations in your field
Collaborative Approach: Your approach to work is characterized by open communication and a convincing presentation of your solutions
Technology Research: You research the latest technologies and actively support the team in the selection and integration of suitable tools, frameworks, and technologies to improve our machine learning portfolio


Qualifications


Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (Master's degree preferred)
Professional Expertise: Several years of experience in MLOps, DevOps, or related roles, with a strong grasp of software development and testing principles.
Communication Skills: Strong English communication skills (German proficiency is a plus).
Skills needed to be successful in this role:
Python Proficiency: Advanced skills in object-oriented programming with Python, including code packaging techniques (e.g., using poetry).
Infrastructure Acumen: Experience with containerization (Docker), pipeline orchestration, and infrastructure as code tools (e.g., Terraform), ideally within cloud environments (Azure platform preferred).
Kubernetes Knowledge: Familiarity with container orchestration using Kubernetes and the ability to contribute to cluster maintenance.
Team Collaboration: A collaborative mindset, dedicating your creativity and motivation to our team's vision.
Continuous Learner: Ability to work independently, prioritize quality and innovation, and embrace new technologies and methodologies.


The Freudenberg Group is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion. Employment opportunities are available to all applicants and associates without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, mental or physical disability, genetic information, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, protected military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Product Analytics
Description:
At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.

We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That’s why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.




Meet the team!

At Preply, we continually run hundreds of A/B tests, each with tailored tracking and analytical requirements. Combined with the broad scope of our product and the complexity of tutor/learner interactions, this creates a landscape rich with rewarding challenges. Visit our Tech Radar to learn about the technologies we use at Preply!

Our Data Team is dedicated to enabling top-quality decision-making. We closely collaborate with product and experimentation teams to deliver insights that optimize the tutor and learner experience. Positioned at the heart of Preply, we leverage data to drive better decisions and enhance data literacy across the company.




What You’ll Be Doing

Data Analysis & Insights: Analyze user behavior and product usage, working with complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems. Communicate insights effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Experiment & Measure: Quantify the impact of new product features and initiatives to identify the most significant growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap.
Visualization & Metrics: Create user-friendly dashboards and visualizations to highlight trends and user behavior. Design tracking events, define engagement metrics and key performance indicators.
Strategic Planning: Organize and prioritize tasks with stakeholders for both tactical and strategic projects. Participate in defining objectives and key results (OKRs) alongside your product manager.
Mentorship: Share your expertise and support the growth of data scientists within your team.




What You Need To Succeed

Experience in data analytics working with product teams, experimenting and uncovering opportunities for product optimization.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Ability to apply statistical techniques to derive meaningful insights and make data-driven decisions.
Familiarity with concepts such as conversion, LTV, cohort analysis, retention, etc.
Curious and creative mindset, with a proactive approach to problem-solving, engaging in the formation and evaluation of new hypotheses.
Interest in the bigger picture, feeling excited to impact the product roadmap and strategy.
Ability to craft compelling stories with data and communicate complex insights in a clear and engaging way, driving change among diverse stakeholders.
High level of self-organization, ownership, and responsibility;




Nice To Have

Experience with product analytics tools (e.g. MixPanel, Amplitude, Heap)
Background in Marketplaces or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C).
Previous experience in mentoring or coaching others.




Our Principles

Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.




Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Product Analytics (AI)
Description:
At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.

We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That’s why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.




Meet the team!

Our new cross-functional product squad is dedicated to enhancing the experience for both learners and tutors. We support our tutors in delivering exceptional tutoring, which boosts student retention and overall learning value. At the same time, we empower learners to continue their education beyond scheduled lessons, integrating lesson content into self-learning and keeping tutors informed about student progress. Visit our Tech Radar to learn about the technologies we use at Preply!




As part of our Data Team, your primary responsibility will be assisting product managers in their decision-making process on how to integrate AI into the company to improve the learning and tutoring experiences we offer.




What You’ll Be Doing

Data Analysis & Insights: Analyze customer behavior and product usage, focusing on the use of AI tutoring and learning tools. Communicate insights effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Creative Solutions: Work with user research and product design to identify innovative use cases for AI-generated data, enhancing the learning experience for everyone.
Strategic Planning: Organize and prioritize tasks with stakeholders for both tactical and strategic projects. Participate in defining objectives and key results (OKRs) alongside your product manager.
Experiment & Measure: Quantify the impact of new product features and initiatives to identify the most significant growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap.
Visualization & Metrics: Create user-friendly dashboards and visualizations to highlight trends and user behavior. Design tracking events, define engagement metrics and key performance indicators.
LLMs and Gen-AI: Evaluate the quality of content generated by AI.
Mentorship: Share your expertise and support the growth of data scientists within your team.




What You Need To Succeed

A genuine interest in how AI can transform education.
Experience in data analytics working with product teams, experimenting and uncovering opportunities for product optimization.
Ability to apply statistical techniques to derive meaningful insights and make data-driven decisions.
Familiarity with concepts such as conversion, LTV, cohort analysis, retention, etc.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Curious and creative mindset, with a proactive approach to problem-solving, engaging in the formation and evaluation of new hypotheses.
Interest in the bigger picture, feeling excited to impact the product roadmap and strategy.
Ability to craft compelling stories with data and communicate complex insights in a clear and engaging way, driving change among diverse stakeholders.




Nice To Have

Experience with product analytics tools (e.g. MixPanel, Amplitude, Heap)
Background in Marketplaces or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C).
Understanding of machine learning techniques, including LLMs and generative AI.
Experience with recommender systems.
Master's degree or PhD in a quantitative field.
Previous experience in mentoring or coaching others.




Why You’ll Love It At Preply

An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub
Access to free mental health support platforms;
Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).




Our Principles

Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.




Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

  • Familiarity with concepts such as conversion, LTV, cohort analysis, retention, etc.
  • Proficiency in SQL and experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
  • Curious and creative mindset, with a proactive approach to problem-solving, engaging in the formation and evaluation of new hypotheses.
  • Interest in the bigger picture, feeling excited to impact the product roadmap and strategy.
  • Ability to craft compelling stories with data and communicate complex insights in a clear and engaging way, driving change among diverse stakeholders.


Nice To Have

  • Experience with product analytics tools (e.g. MixPanel, Amplitude, Heap)
  • Background in Marketplaces or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C).
  • Understanding of machine learning techniques, including LLMs and generative AI.
  • Experience with recommender systems.
  • Master's degree or PhD in a quantitative field.
  • Previous experience in mentoring or coaching others.


Why You’ll Love It At Preply

  • An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
  • A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
  • A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
  • Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub
  • Access to free mental health support platforms;
  • Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
  • The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).


Our Principles

  • Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
  • We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
  • Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
  • Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
  • Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
  • Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
  • Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
  • Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
  • Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
  • One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: Senior Data Scientist -NLP
Description:
Estamos buscando un/a Senior Data Scientist especializado en Natural Language Processing y Large Language Models para unirse a nuestro equipo de Data&Advanced Analytics.

Formarás parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango.




El equipo de Advanced Analytics desarrolla algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial dirigidos a optimizar los procesos y decisiones más desafiantes dentro de la industria del retail.

El equipo de Advanced Analytics de Mango está formado por Data Scientists, Big Data Engineers, Machine Learning Engineers, Deep Learning Researchers e Software Engineers que trabajan juntos en squads multidisciplinares para desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje automático de calidad de vanguardia aprovechando la última tecnología en plataformas de Big Data y computación distribuida.




Cada una de los squads de análisis avanzado tiene como objetivo desarrollar y evolucionar algoritmos de aprendizaje automático para hacer frente a algunos de los principales retos técnicos y empresariales de Mango:




- Generative Artificial Intelligence squad: Equipo transversal responsable de impulsar iniciativas innovadoras relacionadas con algoritmos generativos (texto, imagen, video, etc) en el cual se incorporará la persona seleccionada. Este squad ha liderado el desarrollo de la plataforma de IA basada en LLM para los casos de uso internos. Además, es responsable de impulsar la transformación que se está llevando a cabo en los procesos creativos empleando modelos de IA de generación de imágenes. Este equipo realizará investigación de los diferentes algoritmos disponibles para evaluar su madurez y utilidad dentro de Mango para llevar a cabo pruebas de concepto y su posterior puesta en producción.




- Personalization Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial para proporcionar una experiencia personalizada a los clientes del sitio web y de la App de Mango, incluyendo recomendaciones de producto, ajuste y tamaño, aprovechando las capacidades de despliegue en tiempo real y el flujo de clics en tiempo real.




- Pricing and Mark-Down Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de aprendizaje automático que determinen las promociones y descuentos óptimos para optimizar el margen de la empresa durante el periodo de ventas.




- Purchasing/Production Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de ciencia de datos para la detección temprana de best-sellers y para determinar cuántas unidades de cada producto y talla debe fabricar Mango durante la planificación de la temporada.




Debido a la relevancia de los proyectos de Mango Advanced Analytics, cada squad tiene visibilidad y presentaciones a nivel de junta directiva.




¿CÓMO ES NUESTRO EQUIPO?




En Mango nos inspira y une nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos presentes en 118 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 80 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades, de las cuales el 80% son mujeres.

Somos un equipo muy dinámico, motivado por las nuevas tecnologías, con pasión por lo que hacemos y ganas de asumir grandes retos que nos permitan seguir creciendo y aportando valor a través de los datos.




¿QUÉ HACE UN DATA SCIENTIST EN MANGO?




Como Data Scientist especializado en NLP y LLM formarás parte del equipo que trabaja en la investigación definición, experimentación, prototipado y puesta en producción de soluciones innovadoras basadas en algoritmos generativos de última generación.




En tu día a día…

Trabajarás con modelos de Deep Learning complejos como los Large Language Models (LLM) para abordar múltiples casos de uso. Definirás y llevarás a cabo experimentos para realizar el entrenamiento o fine tuning de estos modelos de acuerdo con las necesidades de cada caso de uso.
Trabajarás con una gran variedad de datos (estructurados y no estructurados), definiendo las fuentes de datos relevantes y preparando el set de datos necesario para entrenar los modelos de Deep Learning.
Implementarás el prototipo de soluciones con algoritmos de Deep Learning para validar la viabilidad técnica y la calidad de los resultados con los equipos de negocio.
Estarás conectado a los últimos desarrollos en Deep Learning e invertirás tiempo en traer nuevos algoritmos a Mango. Evaluaras modelos de diferentes tipos para evaluar la calidad de las soluciones y su posible utilidad.




¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?




Experiencia en el desarrollo de proyectos de data scientist con corpus de textos empleando técnicas clásicas de NLP y modelos de Deep learning como LSTM o BERT. Se valorará la experiencia entrenando o haciendo fine tuning de LLM en casos reales.
Experiencia en prototipar soluciones software basadas en Machine Learning y capacidad para definir la experimentación necesaria en este tipo de proyectos. Se valora positivamente haber liderado el desarrollo end-2-end de un proyecto desde la fase de prototipo hasta la puesta en producción y mantenimiento.
Experiencia en el uso de librerías enfocadas a Deep Learning como Tensorflow o PyTorch.
Al menos 4 años de experiencia desarrollando en Python, u otro lenguaje orientado a objetos.
Se valora positivamente el conocimiento de la teoría en la que se basan los modelos de Deep Learning, así como de las mejores prácticas en su entrenamiento y puesta en producción.
Se valora positivamente las publicaciones en revistas científicas y congresos sobre Machine Learning.
Se valora muy positivamente el interés en buenas prácticas de programación y desarrollo de software: tests, automatizaciones, construyas pipelines en CI, etc.
Se valora haber trabajado con servicios cloud (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud).
Persona comprometida, proactiva, curiosa, con ganas de innovar, y una mentalidad hands-on.




¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?




Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido.
Ofrecemos horario flexible (puedes entrar de 8 a 9.30 y salir de 17 a 18.30) con jornada intensiva todos los viernes (puedes entrar de 8 a 9 y salir de 14 a 15) y la mayoría de las vigilias de festivos
Nuestras oficinas se encuentran en Palau- Solita i Plegamans.
Posibilidad de teletrabajo en un 50%.
25% de descuento en todas nuestras líneas
Te podrás formar a nivel técnico en plataformas como O'Reilly, entre otras, así como en idiomas, y en habilidades para tu desarrollo personal. Te acompañamos para que sigas creciendo a nivel profesional y personal!
Política de referrals, podrás participar en la incorporación de talento a nuestros equipos, ¡y te recompensaremos por ello!
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallès para llegar a nuestras oficinas centrales
Servicio de fisioterapia en las oficinas centrales, así como sala de fitness y vestuarios por si te gusta hacer deporte en tu tiempo libre
Workshops, meetups, comunidades de prácticas, team buildings y company meetings
Paquete de retribución flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro médico, formación, descuento comedor, guarderías etc
Servicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de la central. La empresa subvenciona parte del menú diario, así como los artículos de cafetería.
Servicio médico propio en las instalaciones de la central.
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica, en plena innovación, con gran concienciación y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidad
Ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso, trabajarás con un gran equipo que va en la misma dirección para conseguir los mejores resultados
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo




You got it?

We like you!

Title: Machine Learning (ML) Engineer
Description:
Why Choose TD SYNNEX:

As a Fortune 500 global corporation, operating in over 100 countries, TD SYNNEX values its diverse workforce of 22,000 employees. As the biggest IT distributor in the world, our mission is to provide top-notch technology solutions, empowering businesses and individuals to navigate the digital world safely and efficiently.

About the role:

We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our dynamic AI team at TD SYNNEX. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and deploying machine learning solutions to address complex business challenges and enhance our product offerings.

What you'll do:


Develop and operationalize analytical solutions from conception to completion, including problem definition, data exploration, model development, and deployment.
Adopt machine learning techniques to analyze large, complex datasets and derive actionable insights.
Implement ML algorithms and tools, and develop prototypes per project specifications
Deploy machine learning models in production environments and monitor their performance.
Troubleshoot deployed AI solutions
Explore new machine learning approaches and technologies.
Document steps related to all development processes as well as best practices


What we're kindly looking for:


Solid experience in machine learning concepts and algorithms (supervised/unsupervised learning, deep learning, and reinforcement learning).
Proficient with data preparation including collection, handling, process and transform, feature extraction
Experience with Python, Java, or Scala with preference for Python.
Experience with machine learning libraries and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Good experience with CI/CD pipelines, version control


What We Offer:

We provide competitive compensation with annual salary reviews.

Fully remote In Europe or Hybrid work in Barcelona, Madrid, Munich, Lisbon.

We value continuous learning and provide a clear progression plan.

We provide comprehensive benefits including health insurance, paid leave, retirement plans, and more.

Key Skills

What’s In It For You?


Elective Benefits: Our programs are tailored to your country to best accommodate your lifestyle.
Grow Your Career: Accelerate your path to success (and keep up with the future) with formal programs on leadership and professional development, and many more on-demand courses.
Elevate Your Personal Well-Being: Boost your financial, physical, and mental well-being through seminars, events, and our global Life Empowerment Assistance Program.
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: It’s not just a phrase to us; valuing every voice is how we succeed. Join us in celebrating our global diversity through inclusive education, meaningful peer-to-peer conversations, and equitable growth and development opportunities.
Make the Most of our Global Organization: Network with other new co-workers within your first 30 days through our onboarding program.
Connect with Your Community: Participate in internal, peer-led inclusive communities and activities, including business resource groups, local volunteering events, and more environmental and social initiatives.


Don’t meet every single requirement? Apply anyway.

At TD SYNNEX, we’re proud to be recognized as a great place to work and a leader in the promotion and practice of diversity, equity and inclusion. If you’re excited about working for our company and believe you’re a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply. You may be exactly the person we’re looking for!

Title: Sr Data Scientist - Global Agro
Description:
Overview

Are you ready to drive PepsiCo’s digital evolution and accelerate transformation across our global operations?

As part of the Analytics stream of the Global Agro Digital Transformation initiative, this role will support the development of analytics use cases for Agro, mostly in the data exploration and visualization, and the modeling of agricultural processes (crop modeling, storage modeling). In this role, you will be in charge of generating insights from agronomic data, in order to provide recommendations to maximize the agricultural production of supplies in a sustainable way and with good quality.

Responsibilities

Your day to day with us


Generate insights from agronomic data, in order to provide recommendations to maximize the agricultural production of supplies in a sustainable way and with good quality.
Ensure data access for discovery and proper data is prepared for model usage partnering with data engineers.
Generate analytics pipelines and dashboards to refresh and share results for main use cases, including geo-spatial information, to enable stakeholders to have access to main results.
Support large-scale experimentation and build data-driven models.
Deploy reusable models and recommendations engines to different regions, with proper localization to its particularities.
Research in methodologies to fine tune the approach for every analytics use case, with the validation of leads.
Generate reusable packages or libraries, with proper documentation.


Qualifications

What you will need to succeed


3+ years’ experience building solutions in the supply chain space.
3+ years working in a team to deliver production level analytic solutions - Fluent in git (version control).
3+ years’ experience in ETL and/or data wrangling techniques - Fluent in SQL syntaxis.
3+ years’ experience in Statistical/ML techniques to solve supervised (regression, classification) and unsupervised problems.
3+ years’ experience in developing business problem related statistical/ML modeling with industry tools with primary focus on Python or pyspark development.
Experience using geo-spatial datasets.
Fluent in one Visualization tool, ideally powerBI.


Additional qualifications that will make you stand out for this position


Experience with crop modeling is a plus.
Experience with climate/weather data is a plus.
Experience with remote sensing is a plus.
Understanding of Docker are a plus.


What makes us different?


Hybrid work model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
Diverse team with more than 30% of female representation & over 30 nationalities
Have a stake in D&I strategy and bring your whole self to work


About PepsiCo

We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We are agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways to bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.

PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization - a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people.

So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.


* We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability


#Locations: Barcelona, Spain; Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain


Show more

  • 3+ years’ experience in Statistical/ML techniques to solve supervised (regression, classification) and unsupervised problems.
  • 3+ years’ experience in developing business problem related statistical/ML modeling with industry tools with primary focus on Python or pyspark development.
  • Experience using geo-spatial datasets.
  • Fluent in one Visualization tool, ideally powerBI.

Additional qualifications that will make you stand out for this position

  • Experience with crop modeling is a plus.
  • Experience with climate/weather data is a plus.
  • Experience with remote sensing is a plus.
  • Understanding of Docker are a plus.

What makes us different?

  • Hybrid work model: combination of remote and collaborative office experience to enable innovation
  • Entrepreneurial environment in leading international company
  • Professional growth possibilities & learning opportunities
  • Variety of benefits to support your physical, emotional and financial wellbeing
  • Volunteering opportunities to help external communities
  • Diverse team with more than 30% of female representation & over 30 nationalities
  • Have a stake in D&I strategy and bring your whole self to work

About PepsiCo

We believe that culture should be at the cornerstone of everything we do at PepsiCo. We are agile, innovative and not afraid of failure. We want our team to come to work every day excited to explore new ways to bring enjoyment, refreshment and fun to the world.

PepsiCo Positive (pep+) is the future of our organization - a strategic end-to-end transformation, with sustainability at the center of how we will create growth and value by operating within planetary boundaries and inspiring positive change for the planet and people.

So, if you’re ready to be a part of a playground for those who think big, we’d love to chat.

  • * We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability

#Locations: Barcelona, Spain; Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain

Title: AI ML Engineer
Description:
Descripción





Get ready. Because you’re about to embark on an AI mission to revolutionise small business and accounting practices.

Sage Copilot isn’t just an AI-powered tool. We’re developing a game changer. A tool that will help customers streamline their tasks, boost their efficiency, and unlock new opportunities. Making it a trusted business partner, the likes of which they’ve never seen.

And you’ll be at the forefront of its development, as part of a global team, who can’t wait to collaborate and innovate with you.

We’re working on a truly groundbreaking product. So, is this your next technology job? No—that doesn’t do it justice. This is the future realised—for you, for our customers, and for the shape of technology as we’ve dreamed it.

We are seeking a talented and motivated A.I. Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have experience in programming, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and data science.

The role is to build out Sage Copilot, our innovative generative AI-powered assistant that enhances our customers' productivity.

This allows us to build AI and Machine Learning solutions that will provide insights to empower businesses and help them succeed across a range of our products.

Responsabilidades principales Key Responsibilities:

Teamwork: work within a team to build and maintain cloud-based solutions to support Sage’s business plans and long-term objectives by contributing to our state-of-the-art cloud architecture.

Innovation and Technology: Leverage emerging technologies to innovate and improve the Sage Copilot implementation. Stay abreast of industry trends and incorporate best practices into the workstream.

Architecture and Framework: contribute to the architectural design and implementation of Sage Copilot, ensuring it meets scalability, security, and performance standards.

Collaborate with external teams to integrate provided frameworks effectively.

Knowledge sharing: Share knowledge to help upskill wider teams on how AI technologies can be leveraged in our products. Foster a culture of continuous learning and development to ensure your skills remain cutting-edge.

Performance and Security: Monitor and optimize quality and performance whilst ensuring security protocols are followed.

Skills and Experience:

Desired

Technical solutions delivered in emerging technology areas such as generative AIs, LLMs and Copilots.

Proven track record in delivering high-quality customer technology in cloud computing (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud etc.)

Deep Experience in either C#, Java, or other relevant coding language

Willingness to learn and implement new technologies/languages and drive complex tasks to completion in production.

Expertise in software development best practices and patterns

Experience with API-first product delivery and third-party integration.

Knowledge of the accounting and business software markets.

Proficiency in English.

Key Performance Indicators:

Successful implementation and integration of Sage Copilot across products.

Achievement of project milestones and business growth targets.

Innovation and technological advancements within the Sage Copilot workstream.

Competencies:

Customer Focused: Prioritizing customer needs and ensuring service excellence.

Action Oriented: Taking initiative and driving projects to completion.

Trustworthy: Building trust through integrity and consistent actions.

Innovative: Identifying and implementing opportunities for improvement.

Collaborative: Working effectively with others to achieve common goals.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (w/m)
Description:
At T-Systems, you will find groundbreaking projects that contribute to social and ecological well-being. We want to welcome new talents like you, who bring fresh ideas, different perspectives, embrace challenges, and are committed to continuous learning in order to grow and make an impact on society... all in a fun way!

It doesn't matter when or where you work. It's about doing meaningful work that advances society. For this reason, we will do everything possible to ensure that you have all the development opportunities by providing a support network, excellent technology, a new work environment, and the freedom to work autonomously. We support you in growing both personally and professionally so that you can make a notable impact on society.

T-Systems is a team of around 28,000 employees worldwide, making us one of the leading global providers of end-to-end integrated solutions. We develop hybrid cloud solutions, artificial intelligence, and drive the digital transformation of companies, industries, the public sector, and ultimately, society as a whole.



Job Description



Data Scientist or Python Data analytics Developer with pandas, kubernetes and aws are good to have to be able to operate in project environment

About de Project:

The developed solution is a cloud-based platform that empowers customers with a sea load of data. Using a SaaS model, the platform securely connects machinery in the field to an Amazon cloud. Moreover, the platform delivers the data analytics you need to take fleet confidently into the future.

The platform has customizable dashboards to display the data you can utilize to monitor the operation of your machinery. The data can also be used in other digital products and services provided by us. Data allows responding with speed and intelligence in emergencies and to proactively consult to prevent issues and optimize operation.



Qualifications


Primary: Python, Pandas (for times series), good communication, full lifecycle ownership, AWS (use storage efficiently, deploy to the cloud)
Secondary: Kubernetes/EKS, Jenkins, SageMaker Notebooks.
Good English is a must for this role, as all job interactions are in English. Strong soft skills are a benefit (communication, proactivity, engagement)


Additional Information



What do we offer you?

International, positive, dynamic, and motivated work environment.
Hybrid work model (telework/face-to-face).
Flexible schedule.
Continuous training.
Flexible Compensation Plan.
Life and accident insurance.
More than 25 working days of vacation per year.

And many more advantages of being part of T-Systems!


If you are looking for a new challenge, do not hesitate to send us your CV! Please send CV in English. Join our team!

T-Systems Iberia will only process the CVs of candidates who meet the requirements specified for each offer.

Title: Científico de datos
Description:
Hola Consultores S.L. somos una empresa especializada en la provisión de Servicios TIC e Ingeniería para la gestión empresarial. Trabajamos diseñando soluciones a medida de las necesidades de nuestros clientes.




Somos una empresa 2.0 innovadora donde las personas son muy importantes para nosotros. La ética, transparencia, imparcialidad e independencia forman parte de nuestra filosofía.




Estamos buscando un/a perfiles Middle / Senior DATA SCIENTIST.




Los requisitos son:

· +4 años de experiencia cómo Data Scientist.

· Experiencia de Machine Learning models

· Experiencia en the end-to-end lifecycle of a DS project: data gathering, pre-processing, modelling, evaluation, and deployment

· Experiencia en Python (plus) or R

· Experiencia en SQL

· Experiencia en Cloud (AWS plus)

· Deseable algo de experiencia en gestión y trato con stakeholders de negocio.

· Inglés C1




Disponibilidad para viajar fuera de España.




¿Qué te podemos aportar?

Contrato laboral indefinido y estabilidad desde el primer día.
Todo nuestro apoyo para tu desarrollo personal/profesional.
Incorporación inmediata.
Excelente clima laboral.
Seguro médico privado (completo + dental).
Pago del 100% exámenes de certificación oficial.







Si tu perfil se ajusta al puesto y estás emocionado en formar parte de nuestro equipo, ¡nos encantaría saber de ti! ¡Únete a nuestro equipo! ¡En Hola Consultores apostamos por ti!

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Spain (Remote)
HTML:
Our Team

At Vista Engineering, we are on a mission to become industry-leading in engineering, data, and analytics to create products and services that empower small business owners across the globe in the areas of marketing and design. The Marketing Optimization domain within Vista Engineering focuses on delivering marketing intelligence to power engaging, effective and efficient communication with customers.

As part of the Marketing Optimization domain, you'll join a cross-functional product team named SPACE, a team of seven problem-solving, fun-loving enthusiasts spread across Europe and Boston. Our mission? To optimize our spending in digital channels, such as Paid Search. We're revolutionizing our media campaigns using data, powerful analytics tools, ground breaking technology, and a touch of engineering magic. We have a successful product, but we strive to employ more sophisticated Data Science techniques to help us scale, and we need your help! Joining SPACE means joining a diverse and talented team where each member significantly contributes to our collective success.

What You Will Do

  • Bring advanced Machine Learning techniques into SPACE's suite of data products, driving progressive solutions for our digital marketing spend;
  • Collaborate closely with stakeholders across the business, understanding the problems we are solving, defining success metrics, and effectively communicating methodologies and results;
  • Build new models and algorithms; as well as provide suggestions and help improve the effectiveness of our existing solutions;
  • Champion innovation by generating and implementing new ideas, using the collective expertise of Vista Engineering to turn concepts into actionable data products;
  • Contribute to a roadmap creating data products our customers love.

Your Qualifications

  • 3+ years of Machine Learning models development experience;
  • Knowledge of Deep Learning, including Recurrent Neural Networks and Reinforcement Learning (typical Python libraries include TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, OpenAI, RLlib);
  • Excellent programming skills in SQL and Python;
  • Strength in clarifying and formalizing complex problems;
  • Degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Applied Maths/Statistics or another quantitative field.

Nice To Have

  • Experience in the productionalization of Data Science solutions (model deployment, monitoring);
  • Good knowledge of dashboard creation tools (e.g., H2O Wave, Streamlit);
  • Relevant work experience in an Agile environment;
  • Previous experience in the marketing domain.

Why You'll Love Working Here

There is a lot to love about working at Vista. We are an award winning Remote-First company. We’re an inclusive community. We’re growing (which means you can too). And to help orient us all in the same direction, we have our Vista Behaviors which exemplify the behavioral attributes that make us a culturally strong and high-performing team.

About Us

Vista is the design and marketing partner to millions of small businesses around the world. For over 20 years we’ve been inspired by small businesses, and we work incessantly to deliver solutions to their evolving needs. VistaCreate, 99designs by Vista and VistaPrint, all under the parent brand Vista, represent a full-service design, digital and print solution, elevating small businesses’ presence in physical and digital spaces and powering them to achieve success. Vista is focused on making great marketing and design accessible to every small business owner, allowing them to create a cohesive brand image for use in-store, online and on-the-go.

Commitment To Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion

Vista exists to help our customers live their dreams. Each dream is unique – and the Vista team needs to be as well. We believe in the unique contributions of everyone within a diverse global organization. We are collaborative, inclusive, and innovative. We strive to role model and live an inclusive culture of fairness, respect and belonging for all. And we work together to empower each other, creating a space in which each of us can spark our next great idea.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Vista, a Cimpress company, is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national or ethnic origin, nationality, age, religion, citizenship, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender presentation, legal or preferred name, marital status, pregnancy, family structure, veteran status or any other basis protected by human rights laws or regulations. This list is not exhaustive and, in fact, in many cases, we strive to do more than the law requires.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Product Growth Insights
HTML:
At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.

We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That’s why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.

Meet the team!

As a member of our Data Team, you’ll study and understand user behavior, design experiments, analyze the results and provide insights and recommendations to our stakeholders. You’ll be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, to provide our tutors and learners with the best product experience.

At Preply, we are constantly running hundreds of AB tests, each with specific tracking and analytic requirements. This, along with the wide scope of our product and the sophistication of the tutor/learner interactions, makes for some rewarding challenges.

Visit our Tech Radar to learn about the technologies we use at Preply!

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Master the dynamics of tutors/learners interaction and the economics of Preply’s marketplace;
  • Conduct thorough analysis of customer behavior and product usage, presenting findings to technical and non-technical audiences;
  • Measure the impact of new product features and initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap;
  • Design, execute and evaluate experiments on a global scale;
  • Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators;
  • Partner with Data Strategy & Engineering to define data standards and best practices to model data in our Data Warehouse and productionize your data pipelines;
  • Apply your statistical skills to proactively identify opportunities to enhance our existing methods and to create new ones;
  • Make recommendations to Leadership and stakeholders regarding opportunities to improve the company performance;
  • Work closely with our BI experts to create engaging and meaningful data visualizations, reports and dashboards.
  • Support and mentor other data team members when it comes to technical and statistical concepts and techniques, as well as coding and programming. May also explain new projects to the team and troubleshoot any problems that may occur.

What You Need To Succeed

  • Around 4+ years of experience in a related role, such as Product Data Scientist;
  • Good understanding of data analysis concepts such as conversion, LTV/CAC, Cohort analysis, Retention, etc.;
  • Experience with A/B testing frameworks;
  • Ability to confidently apply data science techniques, such as statistical modeling, in a marketplace context;
  • Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.);
  • Proficiency in analytics languages like SQL or Python;
  • Curiosity, creativity, problem solving and problem finding skills;
  • Solid communication skills, with at least B2 English proficiency.

Nice To Have

  • Experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C);
  • Experience App analytics, tracking and attribution;
  • Knowledge of Looker, Tableau, Amplitude or other BI tools;
  • Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.) and version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.).
  • Masters degree or PhD in statistics, economics, econometrics, or a relevant field of applied mathematics.

Why you’ll love it at Preply

  • An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
  • A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
  • A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
  • Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub
  • Access to free mental health support platforms;
  • Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
  • The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).

Our Principles

  • Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
  • We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
  • Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
  • Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
  • Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
  • Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
  • Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
  • Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
  • Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don’t fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
  • One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
Company Overview

Founded in 1993, Baxter Planning has 30+ years of industry expertise setting the standard for SaaS in the service supply chain planning space. With a strong and growing customer base, we are developing new products and solutions as well as finding new ways to extend and enhance our established products building on our success in the market. We combine the agility and innovation of a start-up with the stability of an established, profitable, global company.

As a Machine Learning Engineer for Baxter Planning, you will be responsible for implementing and supporting Machine Learning lifecycles, and dealing with production problems. We are looking for an individual who possesses strong technical skills, problem-solving abilities, and a passion for data engineering, with a specific emphasis on AWS.Interested? Join us!

Responsibilities:


Work with data scientists to develop, deploy and monitor ML models
Build and manage serverless machine learning infrastructure using AWS services like Lambda, SageMaker, and AWS Step Functions
Implement MLOps platform to automate model lifecycle (develop, monitor, tuning and deploy of ML solutions)
Implement Infrastructure-as-code using AWS CloudFormation for reproducibility and scalability
Identify and evaluate new technologies to improve performance, maintainability, and reliability of our machine learning systems


Requirements:


5+ years of experience in MLOps or Data Science, with a focus on scalable machine learning solutions
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Proficiency in Python and familiarity with machine learning libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn
Deep understanding of AWS services relevant to MLOps, including SageMaker, Lambda, S3, EC2, and CloudWatch
Expertise in containerization and orchestration using Docker
Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code using AWS CloudFormation
Deep understanding of software development lifecycle and maintenance
Extensive experience with one or more orchestration tools (e.g Airflow, StepFunction)
Strong understanding of software engineering best practices and agile methodologies
Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and machine learning techniques
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to handle complex challenges
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, capable of working effectively in cross-functional teams


Powered by JazzHR

Title: Machine Learning Data Scientist
Description:
As a Data Scientist within our core team you role will focus on translating business problems into measurable analytical components involving developing statistical, machine learning models and simulation tools.

What You'll Do

The core team researches and implements model frameworks to continually improve the way of evaluating and monitoring player lifecycles, engagment, tentation and payment trends in our games.

The data science department at Product Madness is made up of over 20 employees based across the globe. With a range of experience, there is also somebody to learn new skills from and develop your career. An award winning team, we push the boundaries of data science and encourage new ways of thinking.

Day to day:
Discuss with stakeholders requirements for analysis
Translate computational solutions/statistical/ML models to python and work with ML engineers to put the developed models into production
Produce Model KPI’s for monitoring the model performances post production to ensure they work as expected
Communicate/present your results to key stakeholders
Write advanced SQL queries to extract/foprmat data as well as use Python/R to do exploratory analysis and develop Models
Collaborate, learn and share ideas & skills with the wider Data Science team
Benefits:

As well as endless learning opportunities and the ability to progress your career you will be well rewarded for your work, below is just some of our amazing benefits.
25 days per year + Christmas closure + BCN Bank Holidays + Birthday off
Yearly Bonus
Cigna - Medical Insurance for all our employees.
GYMPASS - free gym membership
Referral Scheme of 5000€ per referral hired (to be paid after successful completion of probation period)


What We're Looking For
Visualisation techniques to present data analysis
Python to intermediate level
Advanced SQL
Background in using data science to solve business problems
Degree in relevant background - Mathematics, economics, statistics
Experience in building Statistical and ML Models


Why Product Madness?

You will be joining a global powerhouse where you will be part of a world-class talented team that creates remarkable hit games such as Heart of Vegas, Lightning Link, Cashman Casino, Mighty Fu, and Big Fish Casino. The success of these titles has led to over 400 million downloads and more than 50 million active users. But there is no stopping us there, we also have a new games team that is working on bringing new hit games to the market. Product Madness is an Aristocrat Technologies company within its digital games division of Pixel United.

Outstanding growth has seen us build Product Madness to more than 800 team members and counting, you can join one of our seven global talent hubs including London, USA, Canada, Spain, Poland, Ukraine & Israel.

You will be part of a company that is not only Mad about games but Mad about our people. Living by our value of people first, you will feel this firsthand from the moment you step into one of our fantastic studios. This is made possible by our amazing studio experience team who help make Product Madness such a fun place to work. Be it arranging endless snacks, weekly breakfasts & lunches, lavish Christmas & summer parties, happy hour drinks, social get-togethers and so much more.

So what is stopping you from coming and joining the Madness?

Our Values
People First
We have the deepest respect for our people and their well being. We know they are exceptionally talented and will always have a choice. We want them to re-choose us every day. We are committed to building a culture where each person's voice will always be heard and addressed.
MAD for More
Always improving, innovating and never settling for the existing. We push all boundaries with courage and ambition to become the world’s best games company.
Champion Together We excel at what we do but yet remain humble and helpful to our teammates. We champion one another and hold each other to high standards without any egos.
Globally Inclusive
We are all Equal - regardless of the language we speak, where we live, our gender, religion or culture we come from. We want to build a global home, where everyone has the equal opportunity to make an impact.
Customer Focused
We always think from the customer's perspective - be it players or internal customers.

Improving their experience and joy is what drives us. Every client's success is our big win!

Travel Expectations

None
Show more
HTML:
As a Data Scientist within our core team you role will focus on translating business problems into measurable analytical components involving developing statistical, machine learning models and simulation tools.

What You'll Do

The core team researches and implements model frameworks to continually improve the way of evaluating and monitoring player lifecycles, engagment, tentation and payment trends in our games.

The data science department at Product Madness is made up of over 20 employees based across the globe. With a range of experience, there is also somebody to learn new skills from and develop your career. An award winning team, we push the boundaries of data science and encourage new ways of thinking.

Day to day:
  • Discuss with stakeholders requirements for analysis
  • Translate computational solutions/statistical/ML models to python and work with ML engineers to put the developed models into production
  • Produce Model KPI’s for monitoring the model performances post production to ensure they work as expected
  • Communicate/present your results to key stakeholders
  • Write advanced SQL queries to extract/foprmat data as well as use Python/R to do exploratory analysis and develop Models
  • Collaborate, learn and share ideas & skills with the wider Data Science team
Benefits:

As well as endless learning opportunities and the ability to progress your career you will be well rewarded for your work, below is just some of our amazing benefits.
  • 25 days per year + Christmas closure + BCN Bank Holidays + Birthday off
  • Yearly Bonus
  • Cigna - Medical Insurance for all our employees.
  • GYMPASS - free gym membership
  • Referral Scheme of 5000€ per referral hired (to be paid after successful completion of probation period)

What We're Looking For

  • Advanced SQL
  • Background in using data science to solve business problems
  • Degree in relevant background - Mathematics, economics, statistics
  • Experience in building Statistical and ML Models
